Trump nominates Federal Reserve critic Kevin Warsh as its next chair
items.standfirst: Pick of former Fed governor to replace Jerome Powell comes as White House seeks to tighten grip on central bankDonald Trump has announced Kevin Warsh as his nomination for the next chair of the Federal Reserve, selecting a candidate who has been an outspoken critic of the US central bank.The move ends months of speculation about who the president would pick to replace Jerome Powell, as he waged an extraordinary campaign to influence policymaking at the Fed by repeatedly calling for interest rate cuts. Powell’s second term as chair is due to end in May. Continue reading...
items.content: Pick of former Fed governor to replace Jerome Powell comes as White House seeks to tighten grip on central bankDonald Trump has announced Kevin Warsh as his nomination for the next chair of the Federal Reserve, selecting a candidate who has been an outspoken critic of the US central bank.The move ends months of speculation about who the president would pick to replace Jerome Powell, as he waged an extraordinary campaign to influence policymaking at the Fed by repeatedly calling for interest rate cuts. Powell’s second term as chair is due to end in May. Continue reading...

items.title: Schitt's Creek and Home Alone star Catherine O'Hara dies aged 71
items.standfirst: The Emmy-winning actress died at her home in Los Angeles on Friday after a brief illness, her agent said.
items.content: The Emmy-winning actress died at her home in Los Angeles on Friday after a brief illness, her agent said.

items.title: Catherine O'Hara, "Beetlejuice" and "Home Alone" star, dies at 71

items.content: Catherine O'Hara was best known for her comic performances in projects including "Home Alone," "Beetlejuice," and "Schitt's Creek."

items.title: Catherine O'Hara, who starred in 'Home Alone' and 'Schitt's Creek,' dies at 71
items.standfirst: O'Hara enjoyed a six-decade career in TV and films playing sometimes over-the-top, but endearing characters. "I loved playing cocky untalented people," she told Fresh Air in 1992.
items.content: O'Hara enjoyed a six-decade career in TV and films playing sometimes over-the-top, but endearing characters. "I loved playing cocky untalented people," she told Fresh Air in 1992. (Image credit: Chris Pizzello)

items.title: Zelenskyy cautious on Russian bombing pause during extreme cold weather
items.standfirst: Ukraine president says he will wait to see if Putin complies with Trump request to halt strikes on energy infrastructureUkraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, said he was waiting to see whether Russia would observe a proposed pause in strikes on Ukrainian cities and energy infrastructure, as Kyiv endures a spell of bitter winter cold.Donald Trump on Thursday claimed that Vladimir Putin had agreed to halt strikes on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure for a week after he issued a personal appeal to the Russian leader due to the extreme weather in Ukraine. Continue reading...
items.content: Ukraine president says he will wait to see if Putin complies with Trump request to halt strikes on energy infrastructureUkraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, said he was waiting to see whether Russia would observe a proposed pause in strikes on Ukrainian cities and energy infrastructure, as Kyiv endures a spell of bitter winter cold.Donald Trump on Thursday claimed that Vladimir Putin had agreed to halt strikes on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure for a week after he issued a personal appeal to the Russian leader due to the extreme weather in Ukraine. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump claims Putin agreed to halt strikes on Ukraine energy sites amid extreme cold
items.standfirst: US president says he made appeal to Russian leader, but no ceasefire has been confirmed by Moscow or KyivDonald Trump has claimed that Vladimir Putin has agreed to halt strikes on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure for one week after he issued a personal appeal to the Russian leader due to the extreme cold in Ukraine.Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, did not immediately confirm the ceasefire was in place, but said that Trump had made an “important statement … about the possibility of providing security for Kyiv and other Ukrainian cities during this extreme winter period”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president says he made appeal to Russian leader, but no ceasefire has been confirmed by Moscow or KyivDonald Trump has claimed that Vladimir Putin has agreed to halt strikes on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure for one week after he issued a personal appeal to the Russian leader due to the extreme cold in Ukraine.Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, did not immediately confirm the ceasefire was in place, but said that Trump had made an “important statement … about the possibility of providing security for Kyiv and other Ukrainian cities during this extreme winter period”. items.title: What's holding up the funding bill after Senate Democrats struck deal with White House?
items.standfirst: Senate Democrats struck a deal with the White House late Thursday on a funding deal ahead of the government shutdown deadline, but the upper chamber has yet to hold a vote to pass the package. CBS News' Nikole Killion has the latest.
items.content: Senate Democrats struck a deal with the White House late Thursday on a funding deal ahead of the government shutdown deadline, but the upper chamber has yet to hold a vote to pass the package. CBS News' Nikole Killion has the latest.

items.title: Sen. Lindsey Graham says he will lift hold on spending package to avert shutdown
items.standfirst: Republican Sen. Lindsey Graham of South Carolina stalled legislation to avert a partial government shutdown on Friday, but backed off after securing guarantees from Senate Majority Leader John Thune. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has the details.
items.content: Republican Sen. Lindsey Graham of South Carolina stalled legislation to avert a partial government shutdown on Friday, but backed off after securing guarantees from Senate Majority Leader John Thune. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has the details.

items.title: Lindsey Graham Threatens to Block Government Funding Package
items.standfirst: House and Senate leaders have agreed to a spending deal to keep the government open, but funding runs out at midnight Friday. The Office of Management and Budget is expected to issue formal shutdown directive late Friday if no deal is enacted by the deadline. If Congress passes a bill by early…
items.content: House and Senate leaders have agreed to a spending deal to keep the government open, but funding runs out at midnight Friday. The Office of Management and Budget is expected to issue formal shutdown directive late Friday if no deal is enacted by the deadline. If Congress passes a bill by early…

items.title: US Senate agrees to send funding bill to House
items.standfirst: The News The Senate reached an agreement to pass a package funding huge chunks of the federal government through September but setting a two-week stopwatch on the expiration of Homeland Security funding. After a day of haggling with Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., over his priorities, Senate Majority…
items.content: The News The Senate reached an agreement to pass a package funding huge chunks of the federal government through September but setting a two-week stopwatch on the expiration of Homeland Security funding. After a day of haggling with Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., over his priorities, Senate Majority…

items.title: Deal reached to get spending bill through Senate
items.standfirst: The Senate reached a deal Friday afternoon to vote on a government funding package. As part of that agreement struck among all 100 senators, the chamber will vote on seven amendments to a sweeping appropriations package. The Senate will then take a final vote to pass the full package, which…
items.content: The Senate reached a deal Friday afternoon to vote on a government funding package. As part of that agreement struck among all 100 senators, the chamber will vote on seven amendments to a sweeping appropriations package. The Senate will then take a final vote to pass the full package, which…

items.title: Watch: Sen. Lindsey Graham lays out his demands to lift hold on funding bill
items.standfirst: Speaking from the Senate floor on Friday, GOP Sen. Lindsey Graham laid out what he wanted to allow a vote on a funding package with just hours left of the government shutdown deadline. Among the demands was a vote on his legislation to crack down on sanctuary cities.
items.content: Speaking from the Senate floor on Friday, GOP Sen. Lindsey Graham laid out what he wanted to allow a vote on a funding package with just hours left of the government shutdown deadline. Among the demands was a vote on his legislation to crack down on sanctuary cities.

clusters.title: 3D Printing Startup VulcanForms Raises $220 Million for US Manufacturing
clusters.neutral_headline: 3D Printing Startup VulcanForms Raises $220 Million for US Manufacturing

items.title: 3D Printing Startup VulcanForms Raises $220 Million for US Manufacturing
3D Printing Startup VulcanForms Raises $220 Million for US Manufacturing
items.standfirst: Metal parts maker VulcanForms Inc. has raised $220 million in a funding round led by Eclipse and 1789 Capital, the VC firm where Donald Trump Jr. is a partner.
items.content: Metal parts maker VulcanForms Inc. has raised $220 million in a funding round led by Eclipse and 1789 Capital, the VC firm where Donald Trump Jr. is a partner.

items.title: Metal Parts Startup Raises $220M Led By Eclipse, 1789 Capital
items.standfirst: Metal parts maker VulcanForms has closed a $220 million funding round, led by existing investor Eclipse and 1789 Capital, where Donald Trump Jr. is a partner. The company, which uses additive manufacturing, is part of a growing wave of startups using advances in technology to bring manufacturing back to the US. VulcanForms CEO Kevin Kassekert joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Metal parts maker VulcanForms has closed a $220 million funding round, led by existing investor Eclipse and 1789 Capital, where Donald Trump Jr. is a partner. The company, which uses additive manufacturing, is part of a growing wave of startups using advances in technology to bring manufacturing back to the US. VulcanForms CEO Kevin Kassekert joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

clusters.title: Israel will reopen Gaza's border crossing with Egypt on Sunday after nearly two-year closure
clusters.neutral_headline: Rafah reopening set for Sunday as Israel continues to block aid

items.title: Israel will reopen Gaza's border crossing with Egypt on Sunday after nearly two-year closure
items.standfirst: Starting on Sunday, a "limited movement of people only" will be allowed through the Rafah crossing, Gaza's main gateway to the outside world, the Israeli military body in charge of coordinating aid to Gaza said in a statement.
items.content: Starting on Sunday, a "limited movement of people only" will be allowed through the Rafah crossing, Gaza's main gateway to the outside world, the Israeli military body in charge of coordinating aid to Gaza said in a statement.

clusters.title: Andrew went to intimate dinner with Epstein after his prison release, files suggest
clusters.neutral_headline: Andrew went to intimate dinner with Epstein after his prison release, files suggest

items.title: Andrew went to intimate dinner with Epstein after his prison release, files suggest
items.standfirst: Famous figures including Woody Allen were invited to party with disgraced financier and Mountbatten-Windsor, documents indicateAndrew Mountbatten-Windsor attended an intimate party with the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein months after he was released from prison, files suggest.The US justice department released another cache of documents relating to the disgraced financier on Friday.In the UK and Ireland, Samaritans can be contacted on freephone 116 123, or email jo@samaritans.org or jo@samaritans.ie. In the US, you can call or text the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline on 988, chat on 988lifeline.org, or text HOME to 741741 to connect with a crisis counselor. In Australia, the crisis support service Lifeline is 13 11 14. Other international helplines can be found at befrienders.org Continue reading...
items.content: Famous figures including Woody Allen were invited to party with disgraced financier and Mountbatten-Windsor, documents indicateAndrew Mountbatten-Windsor attended an intimate party with the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein months after he was released from prison, files suggest.The US justice department released another cache of documents relating to the disgraced financier on Friday.In the UK and Ireland, Samaritans can be contacted on freephone 116 123, or email jo@samaritans.org or jo@samaritans.ie. In the US, you can call or text the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline on 988, chat on 988lifeline.org, or text HOME to 741741 to connect with a crisis counselor. In Australia, the crisis support service Lifeline is 13 11 14. Other international helplines can be found at befrienders.org Continue reading...

items.title: Jeffrey Epstein sent thousands of pounds to Peter Mandelson’s husband, emails show
items.standfirst: Payments to Reinaldo Avila da Silva raise fresh questions about disgraced financier’s friendship with UK’s former Washington ambassador
items.content: Payments to Reinaldo Avila da Silva raise fresh questions about disgraced financier’s friendship with UK’s former Washington ambassador

items.title: Jeffrey Epstein sent money to Mandelson’s husband after prison release, emails suggest
items.standfirst: Child sex offender sent thousands of pounds to Reinaldo Avila da Silva, according to documents published by US justice departmentJeffrey Epstein sent thousands of pounds in bank transfers after his release from prison in 2009 to Peter Mandelson’s husband, according to emails published by the US Department of Justice on Friday.The latest documents raise fresh questions about Epstein’s relationship with Mandelson, who was sacked as the UK’s ambassador to Washington when details of his support for the disgraced financier emerged in September. Continue reading...
items.content: Child sex offender sent thousands of pounds to Reinaldo Avila da Silva, according to documents published by US justice departmentJeffrey Epstein sent thousands of pounds in bank transfers after his release from prison in 2009 to Peter Mandelson’s husband, according to emails published by the US Department of Justice on Friday.The latest documents raise fresh questions about Epstein’s relationship with Mandelson, who was sacked as the UK’s ambassador to Washington when details of his support for the disgraced financier emerged in September. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Mexico president says Trump tariffs on Cuba’s oil suppliers could trigger humanitarian crisis
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump threatens tariffs on goods from countries that sell oil to Cuba

items.title: Mexico president says Trump tariffs on Cuba’s oil suppliers could trigger humanitarian crisis
items.standfirst: Island country only has oil enough to last 15-20 days, and 12-hour blackouts have become commonplaceMexico’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has warned that Donald Trump’s move to slap new tariffs on countries sending oil to Cuba could trigger a humanitarian crisis on the island, which is already suffering from chronic fuel shortages and regular blackouts.The US president signed an executive order on Thursday declaring a national emergency and laying the groundwork for such tariffs, ratcheting up the pressure to topple the communist government in Havana. Continue reading...
items.content: Island country only has oil enough to last 15-20 days, and 12-hour blackouts have become commonplaceMexico’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has warned that Donald Trump’s move to slap new tariffs on countries sending oil to Cuba could trigger a humanitarian crisis on the island, which is already suffering from chronic fuel shortages and regular blackouts.The US president signed an executive order on Thursday declaring a national emergency and laying the groundwork for such tariffs, ratcheting up the pressure to topple the communist government in Havana. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump to announce Federal Reserve chair pick, threatens new tariffs
items.standfirst: President Trump signed an executive order to establish a process to impose tariffs on goods from countries that sell or otherwise provide oil to Cuba. NBC News’ Peter Alexander explains the details as Trump also says he will announce his pick for the next chair of the Federal Reserve on Friday.
items.content: President Trump signed an executive order to establish a process to impose tariffs on goods from countries that sell or otherwise provide oil to Cuba. NBC News’ Peter Alexander explains the details as Trump also says he will announce his pick for the next chair of the Federal Reserve on Friday.

items.title: Trump threatens tariffs on goods from countries that sell oil to Cuba
items.standfirst: White House cites Cuba’s ties to hostile powers as order ratchets up Trump’s pressure to topple its governmentDonald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday laying the groundwork to slap tariffs on goods from countries that provide oil to Cuba, the White House said.The order, which ratchets up Trump’s pressure to topple the communist government, declares a national emergency and establishes a process for the US secretaries of state and commerce to assess tariffs against countries that sell or otherwise provide oil to the island nation. The White House has yet to specify tariff rates for violating its new policy of blocking Cuba from buying oil. Continue reading...
items.content: White House cites Cuba’s ties to hostile powers as order ratchets up Trump’s pressure to topple its governmentDonald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday laying the groundwork to slap tariffs on goods from countries that provide oil to Cuba, the White House said.The order, which ratchets up Trump’s pressure to topple the communist government, declares a national emergency and establishes a process for the US secretaries of state and commerce to assess tariffs against countries that sell or otherwise provide oil to the island nation. The White House has yet to specify tariff rates for violating its new policy of blocking Cuba from buying oil. Continue reading...

items.content: António Guterres says the international body could run out of money by July due to members' unpaid fees.

clusters.title: Italy: Deep fissures appear in Sicilian town hit by landslide
clusters.neutral_headline: Italy: Deep fissures appear in Sicilian town hit by landslide

items.title: Italy: Deep fissures appear in Sicilian town hit by landslide
items.standfirst: The Sicilian town of Niscemi has been left teetering on the edge of a cliff after days of heavy rains from a cyclone triggered a huge landslide that brought down properties and forced the evacuation of over 1,500 people. Deep fissures are appearing in the ground throughout the area, prompting close surveillance by authorities.
items.content: The Sicilian town of Niscemi has been left teetering on the edge of a cliff after days of heavy rains from a cyclone triggered a huge landslide that brought down properties and forced the evacuation of over 1,500 people. Deep fissures are appearing in the ground throughout the area, prompting close surveillance by authorities.

items.title: Landslide leaves Sicilian town hanging on edge of precipice
items.standfirst: A huge landslide, triggered by Cyclone Harry, has left buildings in the hilltop town of Niscemi teetering on the edge of a cliff, with 1,500 people evacuated from their homes.
items.content: A huge landslide, triggered by Cyclone Harry, has left buildings in the hilltop town of Niscemi teetering on the edge of a cliff, with 1,500 people evacuated from their homes.

clusters.title: California 'Batman' demands US city council act against ICE
clusters.neutral_headline: Watch: Batman tells city council to not assist ICE at Super Bowl

items.title: California 'Batman' demands US city council act against ICE
items.standfirst: A man dressed as Batman made an appearance at a city council meeting in California, demanding local authorities to not provide support for the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Speaking rapidly and angrily, he accused council members of failing to act, using profane language to denounce what he called cowardice and inaction that put lives at risk.
items.content: A man dressed as Batman made an appearance at a city council meeting in California, demanding local authorities to not provide support for the US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Speaking rapidly and angrily, he accused council members of failing to act, using profane language to denounce what he called cowardice and inaction that put lives at risk.

items.title: Watch: Batman tells city council to not assist ICE at Super Bowl
items.standfirst: The unidentified man dressed as Batman addressed Santa Clara city officials to condemn the city's position on cooperation with Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
items.content: The unidentified man dressed as Batman addressed Santa Clara city officials to condemn the city's position on cooperation with Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

clusters.title: Syria and Kurdish-led forces agree on ceasefire and phased integration deal
clusters.neutral_headline: Syrian government reaches deal with Kurdish-led forces

items.title: Syria and Kurdish-led forces agree on ceasefire and phased integration deal
items.standfirst: The Syrian government ⁠and US-backed Kurdish forces have declared an integration deal.The agreement comes after government forces captured swathes of northern and eastern Syria from the Kurds this month, forcing them to retreat into a shrinking enclave. Under the agreement, ​forces will withdraw from the front lines, ‌government units will deploy ‍to the centres of Hasakahand Qamishli, and local security forces ‍will be merged.
items.content: The Syrian government ⁠and US-backed Kurdish forces have declared an integration deal.The agreement comes after government forces captured swathes of northern and eastern Syria from the Kurds this month, forcing them to retreat into a shrinking enclave. Under the agreement, ​forces will withdraw from the front lines, ‌government units will deploy ‍to the centres of Hasakahand Qamishli, and local security forces ‍will be merged.

items.title: Syrian government reaches deal with Kurdish-led forces
items.standfirst: The deal will see the gradual integration of Kurdish forces and administration into the Syrian state.
items.content: The deal will see the gradual integration of Kurdish forces and administration into the Syrian state.

clusters.title: Trump says ‘very dangerous’ for UK to do business with China, after Starmer hails progress in Beijing
clusters.neutral_headline: Keir Starmer opens door to UK visit by Xi Jinping after bilateral talks

items.title: Trump says ‘very dangerous’ for UK to do business with China, after Starmer hails progress in Beijing
items.standfirst: US president warns against closer ties with China during British PM’s trip to secure lower tariffs and better market accessDonald Trump has warned the UK against doing business with China, just hours after Keir Starmer lauded the economic relationship during a landmark visit to Beijing.The US president said it was “very dangerous” for the UK to pursue closer ties with the rival superpower as the prime minister’s three-hour talks with Xi Jinping underlined a thaw in previously strained relations. Continue reading...
items.content: US president warns against closer ties with China during British PM’s trip to secure lower tariffs and better market accessDonald Trump has warned the UK against doing business with China, just hours after Keir Starmer lauded the economic relationship during a landmark visit to Beijing.The US president said it was “very dangerous” for the UK to pursue closer ties with the rival superpower as the prime minister’s three-hour talks with Xi Jinping underlined a thaw in previously strained relations. Continue reading...

items.title: Keir Starmer opens door to UK visit by Xi Jinping after bilateral talks
items.standfirst: PM says trip to China has put relationship in stronger place, but possible return visit angers British criticsKeir Starmer has taken a big step towards rapprochement with China, opening the door to a UK visit from Xi Jinping in a move that drew immediate anger from British critics of Beijing.During the first visit by a UK prime minister to China in eight years – a period which Starmer has described as an “ice age” – he said talks with the Chinese president had left the bilateral relationship in a stronger position. Continue reading...
items.content: PM says trip to China has put relationship in stronger place, but possible return visit angers British criticsKeir Starmer has taken a big step towards rapprochement with China, opening the door to a UK visit from Xi Jinping in a move that drew immediate anger from British critics of Beijing.During the first visit by a UK prime minister to China in eight years – a period which Starmer has described as an “ice age” – he said talks with the Chinese president had left the bilateral relationship in a stronger position. Continue reading...

items.title: Chinese state media views Starmer’s visit as act of economic pragmatism
items.standfirst: PM praised for not pressuring Xi over his ties with Putin on a trip seen as business ‘taking precedence over politics’Keir Starmer’s visit to Beijing has been cautiously welcomed by Chinese state media as an act of economic pragmatism by a beleaguered British prime minister.The presence of 50 business and cultural leaders with Starmer, who is the first British prime minister to visit China in eight years, was taken as a sign that the UK was prioritising its ailing economy over political considerations. Continue reading...
items.content: PM praised for not pressuring Xi over his ties with Putin on a trip seen as business ‘taking precedence over politics’Keir Starmer’s visit to Beijing has been cautiously welcomed by Chinese state media as an act of economic pragmatism by a beleaguered British prime minister.The presence of 50 business and cultural leaders with Starmer, who is the first British prime minister to visit China in eight years, was taken as a sign that the UK was prioritising its ailing economy over political considerations. Continue reading...
